A Nutri-Score calculation pinpoints the nutritional value of a product (based on the ingredients) and assigns it to one of the five colour-coded letter grade classes (A, B, C, D, or E). Products that get an A score have the highest nutritional value â€” those that score an E have the lowest nutritional value.

Eco-Score classes food products from A (low) to E (high) according to their impact on the environment. Eco-Score aims to inform consumers on the environmental impact of the food they choose so as to guide them towards more responsible consumption.

Glycemic Index (GI): If the GI is available, use it as-is.
 Low GI (0-55): +2 points
 Medium GI (56-69): +1 point
 High GI (70+): 0 points

Total Carbohydrates: Use the per-100g value.
 Low carbs (0-10g per 100g): +2 points
 Moderate carbs (11-20g per 100g): +1 point
 High carbs (21+g per 100g): 0 points

Sugar Content: Use the per-100g value.

Low sugar (0-5g per 100g): +2 points
 Moderate sugar (6-10g per 100g): +1 point
 High sugar (11+g per 100g): 0 points

Dietary Fiber: Use the per-100g value.

High fiber (3g+ per 100g): +2 points
 Moderate fiber (1-2g per 100g): +1 point
 Low fiber (0g per 100g): 0 points

Fat Content: This can be further broken down into healthy and unhealthy fats, if the data is available.

Healthy fats (e.g., unsaturated fats): +1 point
 Unhealthy fats (e.g., saturated fats): 0 points

 Glycemic Index(GI) calculation:

GI = ( ( (sugar) + ( (carb) - (fiber) - (sugar) ) * 0.5 ) / (carb) ) * 100
Made successful by Real Vision Team\n(Click Here)
